We need to incentivize companies to share their profits with all of their employees, not just the executives at the top. This bill would help reduce corporate greed and restore the balance of power back to workers. Thanks for the support, @CWAUnion @economicpolicy @IFPTE @IPS_DC

In 2021, CEOs at the top firms in the U.S. were paid 399 times as much as the average worker. In 2020, they were paid 351 times as much, and in 1989, only 59 times as much. This problem is getting worse and workers wages are hurting because of it.

This week, I reintroduced my bill, the CEO Accountability and Responsibility Act in the House. It would raise the income taxes on publicly traded corporations that have extreme disparities between CEO and worker pay.
